    claude-agent-graph Documentation¬∂

    claude-agent-graph is a Python package enabling creation and orchestration of large-scale graphs where each node represents an independent Claude agent session. Build complex, interconnected networks of AI agents that collaborate and maintain shared state through structured conversation channels.

    Features¬∂

    • üï∏Ô∏è Flexible Graph Topologies: Support for trees, DAGs, meshes, chains, stars, and cycles

    • ü§ñ Independent Agent Sessions: Each node is a full Claude agent via claude-agent-sdk

    • üí¨ Shared Conversation State: Persistent JSONL conversation files between agents

    • üéØ Control Relationships: Hierarchical authority via directed edges

    • ‚ö° Multiple Execution Modes: Manual, reactive, and proactive orchestration

    • üîÑ Dynamic Operations: Runtime graph modification with rollback support

    • üíæ Persistence & Recovery: Checkpointing and crash recovery

    • üîå Pluggable Storage: Filesystem, database, or custom backends

    Quick Start¬∂

    from claude_agent_graph import AgentGraph

async with AgentGraph(name="my_network") as graph:
    # Add agents
    await graph.add_node("agent1", "You are a coordinator.")
    await graph.add_node("agent2", "You are a worker.")

    # Connect them
    await graph.add_edge("agent1", "agent2", directed=True)

    # Send a message
    await graph.send_message("agent1", "agent2", "Process this task")

    Installation¬∂

    pip install claude-agent-graph

    Requirements: - Python 3.10+ - anthropic package - claude-agent-sdk
